review: Overall it has met my needs - I've run into network connectivity issues a lot more with the Firestick than I do with the Chromecast, but I also think that is in part to a poor internet connection. Compared to the Chromecast, I think this is less user friendly since everything must be done through the TV using the remote (vs being able to stream directly from your phone). I bought the Firestick since I have Amazon Prime and thought it would be a big variety of movies, but honestly the Prime selection is pretty weak. Some of the TV series are nice, but most that is available (without additional cost) are Made-for-Prime movies and TV series. If I could do it again I probably would have just used the Chromecast and not spent the money on the Firestick.

review: Easy to install, a little clunky to use.  I am replacing cable so it is tough to go from "Channel Up"-ing through 100 channels.  The quality is fine.  Good or bad, the Fire TV stick has substantially cut down on my TV time.  I bought Sling TV to get a few cable channels and I hooked up an HDTV antenna to get the local DFW channels.  Saving almost $70 per month makes it all worth it.  Considered adding one of the $5 add-on packages on Sling, but will save that decision for the end of the 3 month free trial.  Sling costs $20 per month and if you pay for three months in advance, the Fire TV stick is free.  I wonder if I would watch more Netflix if it were in channel format - Netflix Classics, Netflix Action, Netflix Cartoons, etc.
